skill.name: data-processing
skill.description: Process JSON with jq and YAML/TOML with yq. Filter, transform, query structured data efficiently. Triggers on: parse JSON, extract from YAML, query config, Docker Compose, K8s manifests, GitHub Actions workflows, package.json, filter data.
skill.summary: Process JSON with jq and YAML/TOML with yq. Filter, transform, query structured data efficiently. Tr...
skill.author: 0xDarkMatter

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing educational examples for jq and yq CLI tools. All files are markdown documentation with example patterns - no executable code, no network calls, no file system access, and no external commands. The bash code blocks are static documentation examples showing syntax, not actual code to execute.

content.user_title: Process JSON YAML and TOML data efficiently
content.value_statement: Developers need to extract, filter, and transform data from configuration files and API responses. This skill provides ready-to-use patterns for jq and yq so you can quickly query and modify structured data without memorizing syntax.
actual_capabilities: Extract fields from JSON and YAML files using jq and yq syntax
Filter arrays and objects with select conditions
Query Docker Compose, Kubernetes, and GitHub Actions files
Convert between TOML, YAML, and JSON formats
limitations: Requires jq and yq CLI tools to be installed separately
Does not execute data processing commands directly
Cannot process binary or unstructured data formats
Limited to command-line tool patterns shown in documentation

use_cases.title: Query Kubernetes manifests
use_cases.description: Extract container images, labels, and configurations from K8s deployment files for audit and documentation.

use_cases.title: Inspect package.json
use_cases.description: Quickly view dependencies, scripts, and configuration from package.json without opening the file in an editor.

use_cases.title: Process API responses
use_cases.description: Filter and extract specific fields from JSON API responses for testing and debugging workflows.

prompt_templates.title: Basic JSON extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I extract the version field from a JSON file using jq?

prompt_templates.title: Filter array items
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to filter JSON array items where status equals active using jq select.

prompt_templates.title: Query Docker Compose
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I list all container images from docker-compose.yml using yq?

prompt_templates.title: Modify YAML config
prompt_templates.prompt: Update a YAML configuration file with a new version number using yq in-place edit.

output_examples.input: Extract all active users from data.json
output: This filters the users array to include only items where active equals true
The select() function supports multiple conditions with 'and' or 'or' operators

output_examples.input: Get all container images from docker-compose.yml
output: This extracts all image values from services in Docker Compose format
Useful for auditing container versions across deployments
This converts a TOML file to JSON format for further processing
Supports round-trip conversion between TOML, YAML, and JSON

best_practices: Use jq -r for raw output when you need unquoted strings without quotes
Chain filters with pipes to progressively transform data
Test filters with jq '.' first to verify structure before applying transformations
anti_patterns: Using eval or exec with user input to construct jq queries - risk of injection
Processing untrusted JSON without validating structure first
Modifying files without creating backups when using in-place edits

faq.question: What operating systems support jq and yq?
faq.answer: jq and yq work on macOS, Linux, and Windows via WSL. Install with brew on macOS or apt/yum on Linux.

faq.question: What are the resource limits for large JSON files?
faq.answer: Performance depends on available memory. Files under 100MB process instantly. Very large files may require streaming with jq.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Use with file reading skills to first load config files, then apply jq or yq patterns for extraction and transformation.

faq.question: Is my data safe when processing files?
faq.answer: This skill only provides patterns. The actual jq and yq tools run locally. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why are my jq queries failing?
faq.answer: Common causes include incorrect field paths, missing quotes, or malformed JSON. Verify file structure first with jq '.'

faq.question: How does this compare to Python JSON libraries?
faq.answer: jq and yq are faster for quick command-line tasks. Python offers more flexibility for complex transformations and debugging.
